instruction: What metric was chosen to generate a harmonized Chl-a dataset for lakes in the Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of Chl-a retrieval in the related study was the mean absolute percentage error (MAPE). This metric measures the average percentage difference between the retrieved Chl-a values and the actual values. The MAPE was used to assess the accuracy of Chl-a retrievals from both the Landsat 8/9 (OLI) and Sentinel-2A/B (MSI) satellite instruments.

As for how far this metric can go, it provides a quantitative measure of the accuracy of Chl-a retrieval. A lower MAPE indicates a higher accuracy in the retrieval process.

instruction: Can the dark spectral fitting algorithm be used to derive remote sensing reflectance (R-rs) from satellite images for lakes in the Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau in China from 2013 to 2022?
Output: Yes, the dark spectral fitting algorithm can be used to derive remote sensing reflectance (R-rs) from satellite images for lakes in the Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau in China from 2013 to 2022. According to the related study, the study examined the performance of four atmospheric correction processors, and it was determined that the dark spectral fitting algorithm generated better R-rs than the other processors. The algorithm had a mean absolute percentage error (MAPE) of 15.2% for R-rs(561), 27.5% for R-rs(665), and 25.7% for R-rs(704). Therefore, it can be used to derive R-rs for the lakes in the specified region and time period.
